Dear Jennifer Trotter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member was observed sleeping during third shift.
1

Investigation Interviews
Complainant
I interviewed Complainant on 01/08/2024 by phone. Complainant
stated Youth A and Youth B reported Staff Person 1 slept during
midnight shift and did not complete room monitoring checks.
Complainant was unable to provide a specific date or time this
occurred.
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A on 01/11/2024 at Girlstown. Youth A stated
Staff Person 1 sleeps during midnight shift. Youth A stated she
woke up sometime during 01/09/2024 midnight shift to use the
bathroom and saw Staff Person 1 asleep in a chair at the table in
the hallway. Youth A stated she decided not to wake Staff Person
1 and went back to bed. Youth A stated she knew Staff Person 1
was asleep because her eyes were closed, mouth open, and
snored with her head tilted back.
Youth B
I interviewed Youth B on 01/11/2024 at Girlstown. Youth B stated
on 01/09/2024 she woke up at 3:14 AM to use the bathroom and
saw Staff Person 1 with her eyes closed sitting in a chair at the
table in the hallway. Youth B stated she did not wake up Staff
Person 1 and waited until 5:00 AM to use the bathroom.
Staff Person 1
I interviewed Staff Person 1 on 01/11/2024 at Girlstown. Staff
Person 1 stated she began working at Girlstown on 09/09/2023.
Staff Person 1 was asked about the bedtime room monitoring
process. Staff Person 1 stated there is a sheet to fill out and she
tries to check each youth in their bedroom every 15-minutes to
complete the sheet. Staff Person 1 was asked if it was difficult to
remain awake during midnight shift. Staff Person 1 said, “I have
dozed off on midnights. Most nights. I try to keep awake, but it’s
hard.” Staff Person 1 stated it was probable that she missed some
of the 15-minute checks on the youths. Staff Person 1 stated she
last worked midnight shift at Girlstown starting in the evening on
01/09/2024 and ending in the morning on 01/10/2024.
Supervisor
Supervisor stated Staff Person 1 voluntarily terminated her
employment at Girlstown and turned in her work keys on
01/11/2024 following her interview.
Video
2

1/10/2024 video footage at 2:26 AM shows Staff Person 1 sitting
in a chair in front of the staff table wearing headphones. 2:30 AM
Staff Person 1’s head moves forward with her chin pointed
downward towards her upper chest. 2:48 AM Staff Person 1
moves in her chair. 2:50 AM Staff Person 1 takes off her
headphones and shakes her head. 2:53 AM Staff Person 1 gets
up and completes room checks. 2:56 AM Staff Person 1 sits down
at the staff table and puts her headphones back on. 3:03 AM Staff
Person 1 leans forward on the staff table and sits with her head
down on her arms. 3:10 AM Staff Person 1 leans back in the chair,
takes off her headphones, and shakes her head. 3:14 AM Staff
Person 1 gets up and completes room checks. 3:17 AM Staff
Person 1 sits back down at the staff table, puts on her
headphones, and her head moves like she is nodding off.
Document
Room monitoring form for 01/09/2024 to 01/10/2024 midnight shift
was reviewed based on the video review timeframes. Staff Person
1 did not complete the prompts for her signature and date on the
room monitoring form, but the room monitoring form reviewed is
placed between 01/08/2024 to 01/09/2024 room monitoring form
and 01/10/2024 to 01/11/2024 room monitoring form in a binder.
Staff Person 1 documented she completed room checks at 2:35
AM, 2:50 AM, 2:XX (illegible) AM, 3:00 AM, 3:15 AM, and 3:30
AM.
Girlstown’s policy and procedures do not state how midnight staff
may use headphones on duty. Supervisor stated midnight staff are
permitted to wear headphones as long as one ear is not covered
to hear youth activity.
Tour
I toured Girlstown on 1/11/2024. Youth bedrooms are on the
second-floor. Each youth has their own bedroom. A narrow,
rectangular table is in the middle of the hallway pushed against
the wall. Two chairs are placed by this table.
Analysis Staff Person 1 admitted it was difficult to stay awake on midnight
shift. 1/10/2024 video review from 2:26 AM to 3:17 AM shows
Staff Person 1 completed a room check at 2:53 AM and at 3:14
AM, which is over 15 minutes.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Review and determine if midnight staff are permitted to wear
headphones on duty. Revise policy and procedure as needed.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
